channel.title: Voice Over MPLS on 0x000216

item.title: Is Voice Over MPLS The New PSTN?
item.description:
Packet-switched networks are undeniably replacing circuit-switched networks, so much so that the Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) might be phased out by the FCC. This signals the potential end of the century-old telephone system, raising the question of what will replace it. VoIP is a strong contender, but not in its current form. VoIP’s strengths lie in its established standards for coding, signaling, and its compatibility with Ethernet data networks. However, its widespread adoption is hampered by incompatible implementations, concerns from wireless carriers about network overload, and inconsistent voice quality on the internet...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/is-voice-over-mpls-the-new-pstn/

item.title: How Voice over MPLS Expands Enterprise VoIP
item.description:
Many medium and large businesses have switched from traditional phone lines and internet connections to VoIP technology over combined networks to increase productivity and reduce expenses. However, connecting to the outside world can present challenges and potentially negate the benefits of enterprise VoIP. While a high-performing local area network (LAN) efficiently connects everything within a company’s premises, it often stops there. Communicating with other business sites requires routing voice and data traffic over standard telecom services, creating a disconnect between the internal network and the external transport service...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/how-voice-over-mpls-expands-enterprise-voip/

item.title: Managed Voice over MPLS For High Quality Enterprise Telephony
item.description:
Businesses with numerous locations are realizing the financial and operational benefits of MPLS networks. MPLS VPNs are emerging as the go-to solution for connecting multiple sites nationally and globally. But what about voice services? Traditionally, voice and data are kept separate. Telephone systems rely on a proven infrastructure of switched circuit analog and digital trunking. Most PBX systems are designed to connect to standard copper-pair analog business lines or ISDN PRI digital trunks, which act as gateways to the global PSTN (Public Switched Telephone Network) connecting every phone on Earth...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/managed-voice-over-mpls-for-high-quality-enterprise-telephony/
